Class Transaction

java.lang.Object
Transactions.Transaction
public class Transaction extends Object
Represents a financial transaction in the Personal Budgeting Application.

This class models both one-time and recurring transactions with properties for:

  • Transaction metadata (ID, description, category)
  • Financial information (amount, income/expense type)
  • Timing details (date, recurrence pattern)

For recurring transactions, it provides functionality to calculate the next occurrence date based on frequency and end date constraints.

See Also:
  • TransactionService
  • TransactionController

  • Constructor Details

    • Transaction

      public Transaction(int id, String description, double amount, String category, LocalDate date, boolean isIncome)
      Creates a new one-time transaction.
      Parameters:
      id - Unique identifier for the transaction
      description - Description or purpose of the transaction
      amount - Monetary value of the transaction
      category - Category or type of the transaction
      date - Date when the transaction occurs/occurred
      isIncome - Flag indicating whether this is income (true) or expense (false)

    • Transaction

      public Transaction(int id, String description, double amount, String category, LocalDate date, boolean isIncome, String frequency, LocalDate endDate)
      Creates a new recurring transaction.
      Parameters:
      id - Unique identifier for the transaction
      description - Description or purpose of the transaction
      amount - Monetary value of the transaction
      category - Category or type of the transaction
      date - Date of the first occurrence
      isIncome - Flag indicating whether this is income (true) or expense (false)
      frequency - Recurrence pattern (daily, weekly, monthly, yearly)
      endDate - Optional end date for the recurring transaction, or null if indefinite

      public void setDate(LocalDate date)
      Sets a new date for the transaction.

      Used primarily for updating recurring transactions.

      Parameters:

      public boolean isIncome()
      Checks if this is an income transaction.
      Returns:

      public boolean isRecurring()
      Checks if this is a recurring transaction.
      Returns:

      public boolean isActive()
      Checks if this recurring transaction is still active.
      Returns:
      true if active, false if canceled or completed

    • setActive

      public void setActive(boolean active)
      Sets the active status of a recurring transaction.

      Used to cancel or complete recurring transactions.

      Parameters:
      active - The new active status

    • getNextOccurrence

      public LocalDate getNextOccurrence()
      Calculates the next occurrence date for a recurring transaction.

      This method determines when the transaction will next occur based on:

      • The recurrence frequency (daily, weekly, monthly, yearly)
      • The current/last occurrence date
      • The optional end date constraint

      For past occurrences, it advances the date until finding the next future occurrence.

      Returns:
      The next occurrence date, or null if no future occurrences (end date passed)
